intro: Pouteria bakeri, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces edible fruits that encase the highly valued seeds used as nuts. Its growth is slow, and it can reach heights of up to 30 meters in optimal conditions. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
